- Panobinostat: oral, 20 mg/m² twice daily (BID) on days 1‑5 of each radiotherapy week (total 5 weeks).
- ONC201: oral, 125 mg once weekly on Fridays, beginning on week 1 of radiotherapy.
- Radiotherapy: 1.8 Gy per fraction, 5 days/week.

No dose‑limiting toxicities (DLTs) were observed; the highest recorded adverse event was grade 2 nausea, managed with ondansetron.

- Baseline MRI (pre‑treatment): 3.2 cm lesion, no contrast enhancement.

Alternatively, the protocol allows addition of the mTOR inhibitor everolimus (5 mg orally once daily) for patients with documented ACVR1 mutation and sub‑therapeutic panobinostat exposure.
